text: There was talk about an internal mechanism for all the new stdlibs but I suppose that ship has sailed.

elements.text: There was talk about an internal mechanism for all the new stdlibs but I suppose that ship has sailed.

text: I assume there’s thinking that having that would be ideal for the LTS?

elements.text: I assume there’s thinking that having that would be ideal for the LTS?

text: i.e. not having it forces the decision into 1.6 not being the LTS?

elements.text: i.e. not having it forces the decision into 1.6 not being the LTS?

text: Basically we ran out of time

elements.text: Basically we ran out of time

text: and I didn’t want to try and force something that is custom-made for the stdlibs; I’d rather have a more general option for private dependencies that any package can use

elements.text: and I didn’t want to try and force something that is custom-made for the stdlibs; I’d rather have a more general option for private dependencies that any package can use

text: Stefan and I have some “on-paper” ideas that I think are decent ways to encode this in `Project.toml`/`Manifest.toml` representations, but it’s not something we’ve put into code anywhere.  Since Stefan is going to be AFK for a while, I’m not sure when we’ll end up with a prototype.

elements.text: Stefan and I have some “on-paper” ideas that I think are decent ways to encode this in
representations, but it’s not something we’ve put into code anywhere.  Since Stefan is going to be AFK for a while, I’m not sure when we’ll end up with a prototype.
